frame.name: People_by_residence
frame.definition:
<def-root>This frame contains words for individuals, i.e. humans, with respect to their proximity of residence. This relationship may be defined either symmetrically (as <fen>Residents</fen>) or asymmetrically (in terms of a <fen>Known_resident</fen> and a <fen>Indicated_resident</fen>). The <fen>Residents</fen> or the <fen>Indicated_resident</fen> may have an <fen>Age</fen>, <fen>Descriptor</fen>, <fen>Persistent_characteristic</fen>, or <fen>Ethnicity</fen> specified.
<ex>The dead included homeowner Todd Underfoot, 33, his wife Spring Back Underfoot, 32, <fex name="kno">their</fex> <t>housemate</t>, <fex name="ind">Luisa Life</fex>, 46, and two of the Underfoot's three children. </ex> <ex><fex name="kno">I</fex> <m>have</m> a <fex name="eth">Swedish</fex> <t><fex name="ind">roommate</fex></t> that translated for me! </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Known_resident
FE.definition:
<def-root>The individual(s) that serve(s) as a reference point for the definition of the <fen>Indicated_resident</fen> due to the proximity of residences.
<ex>I have no problem with him becoming <fex name="kno">Madonna's</fex> <t>neighbour</t> at all!</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Location
FE.definition:
<def-root>The place in which the <fex name="res">Residents</fex> or the <fex name="ind">Indicated_resident</fex> reside.
<ex>My old <t>house-mate</t> <fex name="loc">in Berkeley</fex> thought it was a hilarious idea.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Indicated_resident
FE.definition:
<def-root>A person or group of people defined in terms of the fact that they reside in the proximity of the <fen>Known_resident</fen>.
<ex><fex name="ind">Bill Jankelow</fex> is my <t>house-mate</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Age
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Age</fen> is the length of time the <fen>Indicated_resident</fen> has been alive.
<ex>Perhaps you know someone who has been doing errands for an <fex name="age">elderly</fex> <t>neighbour</t> for years, or has performed an extraordinary act of heroism or kindness.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Descriptor</fen> is a temporary condition of the <fen>Indicated_resident</fen>.
<ex>If Western's administration is not careful about how they handle themselves in this situation, they could find themselves with some very <fex name="des">angry</fex> <t>neighbours</t> on their front doorstep.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Persistent_characteristic
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Persistent_characteristic</fen> is a physiological characteristic or personality trait of the <fen>Indicated_resident</fen> which is concieved of as persisting over time.
<ex>We don't know his more <fex name="per">irascible</fex> <t>neighbours</t>, of course, but we warm to them anyway.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Residents
FE.definition:
<def-root>The individuals who reside in proximity to each other.
<ex><fex name="res">Smithers and Kornfeldt</fex> <m>are</m> <t>neighbors</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Ethnicity
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Ethnicity</fen> is the religious, racial, national, socio-economic or cultural group to which the <fen>Indicated_resident</fen> belongs.
<ex>With the real estate boom, half of my <fex name="eth">Polish</fex> <t>neighbours</t> have sold their properties for a hefty price to young, left-wing, educated professionals. </ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: roommate.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person occupying the same room, flat, or house as another.

lexUnit.name: housemate.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: A person occupying the same house, flat or apartment as another

lexUnit.name: neighbor.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person living next door to or very near to another.
